byline.original: By BARRY MEIER and JANET ROBERTS

abstract: Venture capitalists are lobbying more aggressively to rein in Food and Drug Administration oversight of medical devices industry; push has alarmed patient advocates and doctors who have been calling on the FDA to intensify oversight, particularly in light of recent failure of artificial hips.
snippet: As Congress considers reauthorizing a law that sets the fees for medical device makers, venture capitalists are emerging as an influential ally of companies eager for a quicker regulatory process.
lead_paragraph: As Congress considers reauthorizing a law that sets the fees for medical device makers, venture capitalists are emerging as an influential ally of companies eager for a quicker regulatory process.

headline.main: Venture Capitalists Put Money on Easing Medical Device Rules
headline.print_headline: Venture Capitalists Put Money On Easing Medical Device Rules
headline.seo: Venture Capitalists Join Push to Ease F.D.A. Rules for Medical Device Industry
